data: The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. According to the report, 9 out of 12 lymph nodes are positive for tumor. Therefore, the N stage is N2, which corresponds to metastasis in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes.
N2

The N stage is not directly provided in the report, but it can be inferred based on the information given. The report states that the patient has no positive axillary lymph nodes (N0) as there is no mention of metastasis in any axillary lymph nodes.
N0
The patient has metastasis in 1 sentinel lymph node (right axilla sentinel node, biopsy) and no evidence of carcinoma in 14 lymph nodes (right axilla, dissection). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1

The report states that there are 23 lymph nodes removed, and 1 out of those 23 lymph nodes is positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to the N1 stage, which is defined as metastasis in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes. The exact number of positive lymph nodes is not explicitly stated in the report, but it can be inferred that it is 1 since the total number of lymph nodes removed is mentioned and only one of them is positive. The other N stage categories (N0, N2, N3) do not match the findings in this report.
N1

The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. According to the report, there are 3 positive axillary lymph nodes (2/14 from part B and 1/19 total) and no positive non-sentinel lymph nodes (0/2 and 0/1 from parts I and J). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1

The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has 1/23 positive axillary lymph nodes (see microscopic description). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1

The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has metastasis in 18 out of 20 examined axillary lymph nodes. This falls under N3 category: 'Metastasis in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes or in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the presence of 1 or more positive axillary lymph nodes.' The total number of lymph nodes removed or the size of the positive lymph nodes are not relevant to determining the N stage.
N3

The report states that there is metastasis in 1 axillary lymph node (1/9), which corresponds to N1 stage. The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes, and in this case, it is 1. The total number of lymph nodes removed or the size of the positive lymph nodes does not affect the N stage. The tumor size and grade, hormone receptor status, and HER2 status are also not factors in determining the N stage.
N1
The report states that 11 lymph nodes were negative for tumor. Based on the rules provided, N0 indicates no positive axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.
N0

According to the pathology report, there is no lymph node metastasis found in the 11 lymph nodes that were examined (1 from Container 02 and 10 from Container 03). The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes, and in this case, there are no positive lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage is N0.
N0

The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. According to the report, there is metastatic carcinoma in one lymph node out of 15 sampled (1/15). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1
The report states that the sentinel lymph node biopsy for both nodes showed no carcinoma (0/1) in each node. Therefore, the N stage is N0.
N0

The report states that the 'Lymph node status: Negative. Number of positive lymph nodes: 0. Total number sampled: 3.' This information indicates that there are no positive lymph nodes in the sample, which corresponds to N0 in the N stage classification.
N0

The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. According to the report, there are 4 positive axillary lymph nodes (3 sentinel and 1 non-sentinel). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1
The N stage is determined by the number of positive axillary lymph nodes. In this report, there is 1 positive axillary lymph node out of a total of 6 sampled (1/6). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1
